newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - South Korean newspapers - June 20.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - South Korean newspapers - June 20.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy.
- Following the financial-reform package to restructure the central bank, the government will soon announce measures to improve the ownership structure of banks.
- New Korea Party chairman Lee Hoi-chang is expected to step down from his current post early next month to ensure fair competition in the race for the ruling party's presidential nomination.
South Koreans scurry to find family members of a 73-year-old former sexual slave to the Japanese imperial army who is living in Cambodia. Her mother is believed to be living in Pusan.
- South Korea and the United States are waiting for Pyongyang's answer to their proposal concerning details of a preliminary meeting for four-way peace talk.
